intro: Mikania crispiflora, commonly known as the curlyleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its delicate, curling leaves and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant is an annual vine that thrives in moist, sunny environments, often found in disturbed soils. Its rapid growth and prolific seed production make it an invasive species in many regions. Despite its aggressive spread, it is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
